medical_history.chief_complaint: The patient presented with fever (38–39 °C) lasting 4 days and bilateral cervical lymphadenopathy.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Earlier, five years ago, while in Sri Lanka, the patient experienced intermittent fever for 12 days, mild cough, abdominal pain, and significant bilateral cervical lymphadenopathy. During the current admission, the patient developed a diffuse erythematous and itchy rash on the trunk, arms, and legs, along with painful lymphadenopathy (3 cm in diameter) in the right side of the neck.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Five years prior, the patient was admitted to a local hospital in Sri Lanka for intermittent fever, mild cough, abdominal pain, and significant bilateral cervical lymphadenopathy. Blood tests at that time revealed very high LDH levels (2360 IU/L) and positive cytomegalovirus (CMV) antibodies (IgG and IgM).
